title: Tutorial: First Playable ROM
content:
# First Playable ROM
Follow this chapter to create a tiny playable scene end-to-end.

## Setup
- npm install
- npm run dev
- Open the local app URL

## Step 1: Create Asset
- Click New and create a blank ROM
- Open Pixel tab and paint a character and a level region
- Use distinct colors for trigger targeting

## Step 2: Script Basics
Add Schema, one Entity, and one Events collision rule.

```
Schema:
  - $Score: { addr: 64, type: Int16 }
Entity.Hero:
  Input:
    - Key_Space -> Action.Jump
Events:
  Collision(Hero:#Feet, Level:#FFFF00):
    - State.$Score = 1
```

## Step 3: Run and Debug
- Click Run
- Enable Debug collision overlays
- Use Alt+Click near overlay lines to inspect baked layers

## Step 4: Save
- Click Save to export PNG
- Reload later with ROM and keep iterating

## Full Walkthrough
See docs/TUTORIAL.md for the full hands-on tutorial.

title: Tutorial: Multi-File Workflow
content:
# Multi-File Workflow
Build organized projects with separate scripts and image assets.

## Step 1: Structure
- Create folders: assets and scripts
- Add image files under assets
- Add main.msc plus feature modules under scripts

## Step 2: Compose Scripts
Use imports from main.msc to compose feature modules.

```
Import: "movement"
Import: "combat"
```

## Step 3: Keep Schema Addresses Unique
Plan variable addresses so modules do not overlap byte ranges.

## Step 4: Switch Files
- Script nodes open Script tab
- Image nodes open Pixel tab
- Save-before-switch flow preserves per-file edits

## Step 5: Validate
- Click Run
- Fix missing import path errors
- Confirm each image file edits independently

## Full Walkthrough
See docs/TUTORIAL_MULTIFILE.md for full details and project layout examples.

title: Tutorial: Team Conventions
content:
# Team Conventions
Use this chapter to keep multi-contributor projects consistent.

## Naming Rules
- lowercase file names with underscores
- PascalCase entities
- Action.VerbNoun action names

## Folder Policy
- assets/ for images
- scripts/ for MSC modules
- keep modules responsibility-focused

## Schema Policy
- reserve non-overlapping byte ranges
- document address allocations centrally
- update schema map before adding variables

## Imports and Boundaries
- keep main.msc as composition root
- avoid cyclic imports
- prefer one-way module dependencies

## Review Checklist
- naming and folder conventions respected
- schema addresses conflict-free
- imports resolve cleanly
- docs index updated when conventions change

## Full Guide
See docs/TUTORIAL_TEAM_CONVENTIONS.md for complete team workflow guidance.

title: Getting Started
content:
# Quick Start
- npm install
- npm run dev
- npm run build
- npm test

## First Session
- Click New to create a blank ROM
- Open Pixel tab and draw a scene
- Open Script tab and write MSC rules
- Click Run to restart with latest assets
- Click Save to export current ROM as PNG

## Startup Sources
You can boot an asset using ?src=<url> or configure game.autoLoadSrc in mozaic.config.json.

title: Architecture Overview
content:
# Runtime Model
Mozaic uses a deterministic 60 FPS loop built around immutable frame updates and a compact byte-addressed state buffer.

## Core Stages
- Load ROM + sidecar script
- Bake static data caches from pixels
- Tick pure logic at 60 FPS
- Render state through WebGL

## Data Regions
- Header: 0..63
- Globals: 64..511
- Entity pool: 512..12287
- Audio / FX: 12288..16383

title: Bake Pipeline
content:
# One-Time Bake
Bake runs on asset load and after editor-changing operations.

## Bake Steps
- Parse MSC script into an AST
- Extract collision geometry from alpha channel
- Simplify polygons with RDP
- Extract path splines and control points
- Cache audio sequencer grids

## Why It Matters
Heavy pixel analysis is moved out of the runtime loop so the frame tick remains low-allocation and predictable.

title: Runtime Tick
content:
# Per-Frame Pipeline
- Sample input actions
- Run physics broad + narrow checks
- Evaluate script rules against state
- Produce next state buffer
- Render and advance frame counters

## Logic Signature
```
(state, input, baked, script) => nextState
```

## Performance Notes
Pooling and fixed buffer layouts reduce GC churn during active gameplay.

title: MSC Script Syntax
content:
# MSC Basics
MSC is a declarative, YAML-like DSL for entities, schema declarations, and event rules.

## Top-Level Keys
- Source
- Import
- Schema
- Entity.<Name>
- Events

## Minimal Example
```
Source: "level.mzk"
Schema:
  - $Score: { addr: 64, type: Int16 }
Entity.Hero:
  Input:
    - Key_Space -> Action.Jump
Events:
  Collision(Hero:#Feet, Level:#FFFF00):
    - State.$Score = 1
```

title: Schema and Events
content:
# Schema Planning
Declare each state variable with byte offset and type.

## Supported Types
- Int8
- Int16
- Int24

## Event Triggers
- Collision(EntityA:#Color, EntityB:#Color)
- Input-driven actions via Entity input mappings

## Action Pattern
Write deterministic state updates in event action lines, for example State.$Health = 0.

title: Audio and Physics
content:
# Audio Sequencer
Audio notes are read from pixel-grid patterns (16x16 or 32x32) and scheduled using Web Audio timing windows.

## Collision Flow
- Broad phase: AABB overlap
- Narrow phase: polygon and color-region tests

## Runtime Character
Collision geometry and path data are baked once and reused across frames.

title: Components Overview
content:
# Components Overview
Components are behaviors you attach to entities in your .msc scripts. Mozaic ships with 23 built-in components across seven categories.

## Physics & Kinematics
- Gravity: constant downward force
- Kinematic: applies velocity to position (exposes $vx, $vy, $px, $py)
- Collider: halts velocity on collision
- Friction: reduces velocity toward zero

## Controllers
- PlayerController: maps Action.Left/Right/Up/Down to velocity
- TopDownController: maps Action.MoveLeft/Right/Up/Down to velocity
- PlatformController: side-scrolling with jump (exposes $isGrounded, $vy)

## Gameplay
- Health: deactivates entity at 0 HP (exposes $hp, $maxHp)
- Lifetime: countdown timer that destroys the entity
- Navigator: follows baked Bezier paths

## Combat
- Hitbox: AABB overlap check with damage and knockback

## AI & Logic
- Wanderer: random direction picker at intervals
- Chaser: moves toward a target entity type
- Spawner: emits new entities at intervals

## Interaction
- Interactable: radius-based trigger (exposes $triggered)
- AreaTrigger: AABB trigger zone (exposes $triggered)

## Drawing & Effects
- Camera: follows entity, controls zoom/tint/shake
- ScreenShake: random camera offset for impact effects
- SpriteAnimator: cycles sprite frames for animation
- ParticleEmitter: spawns child entities with random velocity

## Experimental
- SineWave: sine-wave velocity oscillation
- Patrol: back-and-forth movement
- Blink: toggles visibility on/off

## Full Reference
See docs/COMPONENTS.md for props, context variables, and usage examples.

title: Components List
content:
# Components List
All 23 user-usable components with their category and key properties.

## Physics & Kinematics
- Gravity — Props: force (default 1)
- Kinematic — Context: $vx, $vy, $px, $py
- Collider — No props
- Friction — Props: factor (default 0.9)

## Controllers
- PlayerController — Props: speed (default 1). Uses Action.Left/Right/Up/Down
- TopDownController — Props: speed (default 1). Uses Action.MoveLeft/Right/Up/Down
- PlatformController — Props: speed (default 1), jumpForce (default 5). Context: $isGrounded, $vy

## Gameplay
- Health — Props: maxHp (default 100). Context: $hp, $maxHp
- Lifetime — Props: frames (default 60)
- Navigator — Props: speed (default 1), pathIndex (default 0)

## Combat
- Hitbox — Props: width (16), height (16), damage (1), knockback (4)

## AI & Logic
- Wanderer — Props: speed (default 1), interval (default 60)
- Chaser — Props: speed (default 1), targetType (default 1)
- Spawner — Props: entity (default 0), interval (default 60), speedX (0), speedY (0)

## Interaction
- Interactable — Props: radius (16), action (Action.Interact), targetType (1). Context: $triggered
- AreaTrigger — Props: width (16), height (16), targetType (1). Context: $triggered

## Drawing & Effects
- Camera — Props: zoom (1), shake (0), tint (#FFFFFF), followSpeed (1), zoomSpeed (1)
- ScreenShake — Props: intensity (default 2)
- SpriteAnimator — Props: frames (default 10), count (default 2)
- ParticleEmitter — Props: rate (1), lifetime (30), typeId (0)

## Experimental
- SineWave — Props: frequency (0.1), amplitude (1), axis (y)
- Patrol — Props: speed (1), axis (x)
- Blink — Props: interval (30)

## Full Reference
See docs/COMPONENTS.md for complete documentation with examples.

title: Entity State Reference
content:
# Entity State Reference
Entities can change appearance and behavior dynamically based on conditions.

## Defining States
States are defined under the States: key in an entity definition.

## How States Work
- Evaluation Order: Top to bottom
- First Match Wins
- Fallback: Uses base definition if no condition is met

## Writing Conditions
- Operators: ==, !=, >, <, >=, <=, ||, &&

## Context Variables
- Kinematic: $vx, $vy, $px, $py
- Health: $hp, $maxHp
- PlatformController: $isGrounded, $vy
- Interactable: $triggered
- AreaTrigger: $triggered
- Global: State.$varName or $varName

## Overriding Properties
- Visual: Changes sprite
- Components: Updates properties (Gravity, Speed)

## Full Reference
See docs/ENTITY_STATES.md for complete details and examples.
